1.name: Spencer Butte Trail
1.description: This [1.7 mile, 741 feet elevation gain] hike is one of the most popular in Eugene, Oregon. Allocate about an 1 hour 20 minutes to complete this adventure and don't forget to take a break and soak up some amazing views once you reach the top.
1.isRain: Yes, for most of the hike you'll be in the forest, so you won't get rained on too hard. Keep in mind that once you get to the top you'll be less likely to spot the amazing views.
1.isSnoworIce: No, this hike has steep, rocky parts that would be dangerous when snow/ice is present

1.name: Float the Willamette River
1.description: Grab your kayak, canoe, floaty, or paddle board and enjoy a relaxing, yet exhilirating excursion down the Willamette River. Drop into the river at West D Boat Ramp (N Willamette St, Eugene, OR 97408) and pop out at River Wood Beach (340 N Adams St, Eugene, OR 97402) for a solid 2 hour float down the river.
1.isRain: No, the water in the river is cold. You will get wet going down this river and we do not reccomend floating down it unless it is sunny and warm.

1.name: Float the Willamette River
1.description: Grab your kayak, canoe, floaty, or paddle board and enjoy a relaxing, yet exhilirating excursion down the Willamette River. Drop into the river at West D Boat Ramp (N Willamette St, Eugene, OR 97408) and pop out at River Wood Beach (340 N Adams St, Eugene, OR 97402) for a solid 2 hour float down the river.
1.isRain: No, the water in the river is cold. You will get wet going down this river and we do not reccomend floating down it unless it is sunny and warm.

1.name: Rock Climbing
1.description: Head over to the University of Oregon Rec Center for this one. It's cold, it's raining, maybe it's snowing... all we know is that we are looking for a non-outdoor activity today, and we've got one for you! Head over the the rec center rock wall to spend some time bouldering. Luckily for you (if you're a student) this wall is totally free and you can even rent shoes there. All you need to bring is your student id and yourself. Enjoy some heart racing moments!

1.name: Alton Baker
1.description: Spend the day leisurely walking or biking through the vast park that is Alton Baker, which spans from Eugene, Springfield, Coburg, and the Valley River areas. The paths in Alton Baker include paved bike paths as well as running and walking paths.

2.name: Willamette Pass Ski Resort
2.description: Willamette Pass Resort offers access to 555 acres of lift-served trails perfect for skiing, cross country skiing, or even snow shoeing! The perfect snow activity, dedicate an entire day towards this activity, but you can participate in the adventure as long/short as you want. Never skiied or snowboarded before? They offer lessons!
2.isClear: Yes, although this is a winter only activity
2.isRain: No, either snow or blue skies, there is no in-between on this one.
2.address: 27501 Hwy 58, Mile Marker 62, Crescent Lake, OR 97733

2.name: Fern Ridge Reserviour
2.description: Fern Ridge Reservoir is an amazing lake for boaters throughout the Willamette Valley and beyond. It is considered one of the best sailing lakes in the Northwest! Enjoy sailing on a gusty day.
2.address: Fern Ridge Lake, 26647 OR-126, Veneta, OR 97487

2.name: Whale Watching
2.description: No matter what time of year, you might see whales along the Oregon Coast. From mid-December to mid-January you can see the gray whales on their way down to Mexico. In late March through early June you could catch them on their way back up to Alaska. Finally, summer and fall bring these whales close to the shore to feed.

2.name: Star Gazing
2.description: In the midst of a rocky lava landscape, discover this memorable monument. This historical observatory, built of lava rock, offers stunning panoramic views of Cascade Mountain peaks.

2.name: Sand boarding on the Oregon Dunes
2.description: Cruise down the Oregon Dunes for a uniquely exhilerating experience!
